subject: Sales
title: Amazon and the Death of Distance
description: A quick win: understand Amazon and the Death of Distance.

hook.text: Bezos started selling books from a garage in 1994. Decades later, Amazon sells nearly everything.

buildup.text: Amazon erased geography. Any product could reach any buyer, anywhere, often by the next morning.

discovery.text: One-click buying, reviews, and personalized recommendations reshaped consumer expectations entirely.

twist.text: Amazon also sparked a race to the bottom on price. Small sellers compete on a platform they don't own.

climax.text: Amazon proved convenience wins. Remove friction and buyers choose you over closer, friendlier options.

punchline.text: Amazon proved convenience beats everything else.

quiz.question: What fundamental principle did Amazon prove?
options: Only tech companies can sell online
